Dead By Daylight is a great game whether it'd be solo or playing with a bunch of friends. The community can be so toxic at times but, its all fun and games. You will almost always find yourself being called a tunneler or camper by survivors no matter how "fair" you play. The game often has its annoying bugs but Devs are usually quick to give it a fix. Overall 8/10 rating for this survival horror game.

fix ur fucking matchmaking so i can actually learn to do shit as a survivor/killer at my own fucking level. its hard to learnt when i'm rank 9 going against sweaty red ranks, thats the reason i bought this game ON SALE. not worth full price for a half-assed game.

Primero que nada, ¬°Buenas Tardes!
Por medio de la presente hago constar que recomiendo el juego Dead By Daylight, debido a sus diferentes mec√°nicas con las que cuenta para los personajes de asesinos como sobrevivientes. Sin duda el precio es muy accesible para todo lo que ofrece, ademas que los creadores est√°n trabajando constantemente, implementando en cierto tiempo nuevos personajes. Sin duda se tendr√° muchas horas de entretenimiento en lo que uno va conociendo todas las habilidades que existen al mismo tiempo que sube de nivel a su personaje favorito.
Como en todos los v√≠deo juegos existen aspectos negativos, los que me han sucedido son:
1.- Bugs (estos aparecen debes en cuando, en actualizaciones que se implementan).
2.- Matchmaking horrible (El juego te empareja como quiere, as√≠ que si vas de asesino y eres nuevo que no te sorprenda enfrentarte a 4 sobrevivientes experimentados o viceversa si eres un sobreviviente novato enfrentarte a un asesino experimentado).
3.- Tiempo de espera alto (en mi caso encontrar un partida de asesino me toma m√≠nimo 10 minutos y de sobreviviente me toma 5 minutos).
4.- Te podr√°s encontrar jugadores t√≥xicos (simplemente ign√≥ralos, dir√≠a que los reportes, pero actualmente el sistema para reportar jugadores no inflige sanciones y bloquearlos no garantiza que no te los vuelvas a topar).

En fin eso es todo amigos, en mi opini√≥n es buen juego, recomiendo que lo prueben.
Saludos.

This game was a hit from the first time I watched a couple of Youtubers and Twitch streamers play it, and then I bought it for myself. The learning curve was so steep. There isn't much instruction when you begin and the game is plain hard, but over time as my skills increased I have fallen in love with this game. The matches are short and high octane, and I love the idea of a multiplayer horror game where one of the players is the killer. I love it. Long live DbD, 4 years strong!

I have four suggestions, these are just throwaways, and I doubt they'll get any attention, but here they are.

1. Item Trading.
The ability to hold out an item to trade during a trial, where both can see the others item, and both can press the secondary action button to accept, or walk away to decline. This could let survivors know before they drop their item what they're getting, or to see what item their teammate has.

2. Chest Skill Checks
Survivors will have skill checks (not affected by Killer skill check perks) to determine the durability, tier, and possibly, if running Ace in the Hole, add-on's. This would help change the courses of games, and depending on how well you do, your life. Perks like Plunderers could be used to affect Skill Checks on chest as well.

3. Community Made Run/Walk Cycles
Competitions for new (dev approved) animations for certain effects could be held, where the winner's could be implemented as a buy-able swap-out for the normal (normal running and walking being most costly, rarely seen ones (such as Tier 3 Insanity Doctor's) being the cheapest. This would allow more diversity, yet still no insane or unrealistic qualities, to how Survivors or Killers look.

4. Secondary Items
These would be one use items, separate in key bind and use, from main items. These could be used much like firecrackers, having a single use while still bringing a dramatic new amount of possibility to synergies and overall gameplay. This is the biggest stretch of all these suggestions, but still could be something to look at.

So other than that, incredible game, despite the memes everything works great, yadayadayada hitboxes, something something entitled player. Thanks for making an incredible game, look forward to what comes next.

One of my favorite games by any means. It is honestly very fun to play and engaging. However you will get sick of it eventually. The thing is, many times after playing this game for a couple months straight, i'd take a break, just because the amount of times you get frustrated at it. Its a very fun game, but others can make it unfun. I would definitely suggest getting this even at full price. Sucks for new players although if you hold out, it definitely gets better. 8/10

This is a great game! BUT, you have to play it with with a mic through Discord or another voice call program. A team based game without the ability to communicate is VERY frustrating when playing as a Survivor. I have yet to play as a Killer, but it honestly looks really fun albeit a bit lonely without any social interaction. I've played 30 hours with random people on the Dead by Daylight Discord server, and it has been a blast! I've played the other 10 hours off of Discord, and the game is still fun, but it get's old when you cannot share the experience.

Update: 320 hours later, and I now mainly play killer. This game is still really fun, but playing killer can get a little lonely. I enjoy sharing my screen on Discord as I play killer. It makes the games way more enjoyable. I really only play Survivor to do the Tome challenges and when I play with friends through Discord.

There have been a few updates since I first bought the game including two major graphics updates that really stressed computers. My three year old basic PC struggled even more after the graphic updates, and playing at 60 fps was a pipe dream. Most recently though, I've finally purchased a gaming computer, and now I'm playing whatever I want at high settings including DBD at 120 fps.

The vocal community in general is still toxic, and it finds a way to complain about anything. Because of that, I am never on DBD's official Discord anymore. But, the best part is finding small communities of streamers who are extremely helpful or even wholesome. Otzdarva is a great streamer to watch and so is Umbra. The latter is a bit less wholesome, but that's mainly because Otzdarva seems like such a standup guy. They are both entertaining, and learned a lot about DBD from both of them.
